Package com.eclipsesource.tabris.widgets.swipe

Class Swipe

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eclipsesource.tabris.widgets.swipe.Swipe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Swipe
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    A Swipe object can be used to navigate through a stack of Composite objects (represented by a SwipeItemusing a swipe gesture. The content of a Swipe can be modified in a dynamic way using a SwipeItemProvider. To increase the user experience the content of each item can be pre-loaded.

    E.g. the default size of pre loaded items is 1. This means when you show item 1, item 0 an 2 will be pre loaded. The size of this pre loading cache is configurable and can change during runtime.

    It's also possible to lock item in two directions. This means when a item 1 is locked with SWT.LEFT a user is not able to swipe to item 0.

    Since:
    0.10
    See Also:
    SwipeItemProvider, SwipeListener, SwipeContext, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Swipe

        public Swipe​(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent,
             SwipeItemProvider itemProvider)

    • Method Detail

      • setCacheSize

        public void setCacheSize​(int size)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Configures the amount of pre loaded items. A size of 2 means that when showing item 3, item 1, 2, 4 and 5 will be loaded. The cache size must be > 0.

        Note: On iOS at least two pre loaded items are needed to make swipe work as intended.

        Parameters:
        size - The amount of item to pre loading each direction.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when cache size is <= 0

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Triggers a refresh to get new input from the SwipeItemProvider. This is like calling the show method with the current index.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the current item was removed in the SwipeItemProvider.

      • show

        public void show​(int index)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Shows the item at the given index. Calling this method is comparable with a programmatic swiping to a given item.

        Parameters:
        index - the index of the item to swipe to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the passed index is negative or does not exist in the SwipeItemProvider.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when already disposed or the move is not valid e.g. when a item is locked.

      • addSwipeListener

        public void addSwipeListener​(SwipeListener listener)

        Adds a SwipeListener to get notified about swipping events.

      • removeSwipeListener

        public void removeSwipeListener​(SwipeListener listener)

        Removes the given SwipeListener.

      • getControl

        public org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control getControl()

        Returns the underlying control. This control is the parent of all SwipeItems. Should only be used to do layouting stuff.

      • getContext

        public SwipeContext getContext()

        Returns the SwipeContext that is shared during all swipping events.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()

        Disposes the complete Swipe object and all it's children.
